title: Forgot Admin Password - Recovery Options
content:
## Critical Warning

**There is NO password recovery option.**

If you forget your admin password, you cannot:
- Open Settings
- Change any configuration
- Add/edit/remove projectors
- Access security settings
- Modify UI settings

The admin password is secured with industry-standard encryption and **cannot** be recovered or reset without reinstalling the application.

## What This Means

**You are locked out of:**
- Settings dialog (Ctrl+, won't work)
- Projector configuration
- Connection settings
- UI customization
- All preference changes

**You can still:**
- Control existing configured projectors
- Power on/off, change inputs
- Use system tray quick actions
- View history panel
- Use the application for daily operations

## Your Options

### Option 1: Try Common Passwords (If You Might Remember)

**Before giving up, try:**
1. Your most common password
2. Check if Caps Lock is ON (password is case-sensitive)
3. Check if Num Lock affects your password
4. Try password without special characters (maybe you misremembered)
5. Try variations you commonly use

**Do NOT:**
- Try too many times randomly
- There's no lockout, but wasting time won't help

### Option 2: Restore from Backup (If Available)

**If you have a backup:**

1. Locate backup file:
   - Default location: Where you saved backups
   - File name: `projector_control_backup_YYYY-MM-DD_HHMMSS.enc`

2. Close the application completely:
   - Right-click system tray icon
   - Select **Exit**

3. Run backup restore (if you created a restore script):
   - OR contact IT administrator for help

4. Backup includes:
   - Admin password (hashed)
   - All projector configurations
   - All settings
   - History (if included in backup)

**Limitations:**
- Only works if you created backups
- Restores to backup date (loses recent changes)
- May need IT help to restore

### Option 3: Reinstall (Last Resort)

**If no backup and can't remember password:**

You must reinstall and reconfigure from scratch.

**âš  Warning:** This deletes ALL configuration:
- Admin password
- All projector configurations
- All settings
- All operation history

**Steps:**

1. **Export current projector list** (if possible):
   - You cannot access Settings, so this may not be possible
   - Skip to step 2

2. **Document current configuration:**
   - Take screenshots of main window
   - Note projector names, IP addresses (visible in status panel)
   - Note any custom settings you remember

3. **Close application:**
   - Right-click system tray icon > Exit

4. **Delete application data:**
   - Open File Explorer
   - Navigate to: `%APPDATA%\ProjectorControl`
   - Delete entire folder
   - Also delete: `%APPDATA%\ProjectorControl\.projector_entropy`

5. **Restart application:**
   - Launch ProjectorControl.exe
   - First-run wizard will start automatically

6. **Reconfigure from scratch:**
   - Set new admin password (WRITE IT DOWN THIS TIME!)
   - Re-add all projectors using documented info
   - Re-configure all settings

## Prevention: Never Forget Again

**After regaining access (or reinstalling):**

1. **Write down password immediately:**
   - Physical paper in secure location
   - NOT on sticky note on monitor
   - NOT in text file on desktop
   - Secure location only you access

2. **Use password manager:**
   - Store in enterprise password manager
   - LastPass, 1Password, KeePass, etc.
   - Label clearly: "Projector Control Admin Password"

3. **Create regular backups:**
   - Settings > (future backup feature)
   - Backup includes encrypted admin password
   - Store backups securely
   - Test restore procedure

4. **Coordinate with IT:**
   - If IT manages the application
   - They may have password in secure vault
   - Ask IT to document password

5. **Choose memorable password:**
   - Not "password123"
   - But also not "aK9$mZ2@pL5#qW8" that you'll forget
   - Balance security with memorability
   - Passphrase often better than random characters

## Why No Recovery Option?

**Security design:**
- Recovery options weaken security
- Secret questions can be guessed
- Password reset emails can be intercepted
- This is a desktop app, not a web service

**The admin password protects:**
- Projector credentials (could control building-wide systems)
- Network configuration (could expose IT infrastructure)
- Security settings (encryption, backups)

A strong security model requires no backdoor.

## If You Must Reinstall

**Make it easier next time:**

1. Use consistent projector naming
2. Document IP addresses
3. Take screenshots of settings
4. Create backup immediately after setup
5. Test backup restore while you remember the password

## When to Contact IT

- Need help restoring from backup
- Need projector IP addresses and passwords
- Want IT to store admin password in enterprise vault
- Need approval to delete and reinstall

> **Prevention is the only cure.** Write down your admin password and store it securely! Consider using a password manager. There is no password recovery feature by design.
